item.title: Collisions
item.description: Most of the following are my personal notes on Jeff Wagners awesome masterclass on Collisions. It’s a bit on the longer side of presentations (6ish hours in 3 parts), but I highly recommend watching it!

item.title: Crowds
item.description: The following notes only cover crowds with rigged agents, which are evaluated in real time during the simulation. Simple setups with instanced geometry caches are not covered here but may just as well be a viable solution.

item.title: FLIP
item.description: General Particle Velocity vs Volume Velocity It’s hard to have exact art directable control over the FLIP particles when working with volume velocities.

item.title: POP
item.description: Initializing Attributes inside DOPs Sometimes you want to initialize / build some attribute based on the geometry of the frame before.

item.title: Retiming Techniques for Pyro
item.description: Timescale in Simulation The Timescale parameter let’s you control the speed at which a solver simulates. However you have to make sure to scale up or down any forces that affect velocity accordingly.
